alert.note: Alert for Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 1:54AM EDT until May 05 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schroon River At Riverbank. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water reaches minor flood stage with water in nearby lowlands and outbuildings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 7.0 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.8 feet on 03/25/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Schroon River Riverbank Flood Stage: 7.0 Observed Stage at Thu 1 am: 6.9 Forecast: Thu 2 am 6.9 Thu 8 am 7.0 Thu 2 pm 7.0 Thu 8 pm 7.0 Fri 2 am 6.9 Fri 8 am 6.9 Fri 2 pm 6.8 Fri 8 pm 6.7 Sat 2 am 6.6 Sat 8 am 6.5 Sat 2 pm 6.3 Sat 8 pm 6.2 &&
